Menengok PLTS Krayan, Pemasok Listrik Alternatif di Perbatasan
07 Nov 2019, 03:21 by Pradita Utama
 Nunukan - Panel surya bantu aktivitas warga di perbatasan Indonesia. Meski kini listrik telah masuk, panel surya tetap masih digunakan di desa yang belum teraliri listrik



Pembangkit listrik tenaga surya (PLTS) merupakan salah satu pemasok listrik di kawasan Krayan, Kabupaten Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara, yang berada di perbatasan antara Indonesia dengan Malaysia.
 



Meski PLN pada tahun ini telah berhasil mengalirkan listrik di wilayah Krayan, panel surya masih kerap digunakan sebagai alternatif karena masih ada beberapa desa yang belum tersentuh listrik.
 



Salah satu PLTS yang menjadi pemasok listrik bagi sejumlah wilayah di Krayan berada di area sekitar Bandara Yuvia Semaring dan Pos Gabma Satgas Pamtas TNI dan RRD.
 



PLTS di Bandara Yuvia Semaring kerap digunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan listrik di kawasan bandara.
 



Sedangkan PLTS di Pos Gabma Satgas Pamtas digunakan untuk menjadi tenaga listrik cadangan.
 



Sebelum PLN berhasil menembus wilayah perbatasan Indonesia-Malaysia, kawasan tersebut menggunakan panel surya untuk mendapatkan listrik yang digunakan untuk membantu aktivitas masyarakat sehari-hari.
 



Namun, karena panel surya membutuhkan sinar matahari sebagai pemasok energi, pasokan listrik pun menjadi terbatas karena di saat malam hari warga tak dapat mengisi daya. Oleh karena itu, penggunaan panel surya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan listrik dihemat pemakaiannya sedemikian rupa agar cukup untuk digunakan hingga malam hari.
 



Namun kini warga di perbatasan Indonesia-Malaysia tak perlu lagi khawatir kehabisan listrik di malam hari. Pasalnya, PLN telah berhasil mengalirkan listrik ke sejumlah wilayah di Krayan, Kabupaten Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara. PLTS pun digunakan sebagai pemasok listrik alternatif atau menjadi tenaga listrik cadangan di wilayah perbatasan tersebut.

Look at PLTS Krayan, Alternative Electric Suppliers at the Border
Nov 7 2019, 03:21 by Pradita Utama
Nunukan - Solar panels help citizen activities on the Indonesian border. Even though electricity is now coming in, solar panels are still being used in villages that have not been electrified



The solar power plant (PLTS) is one of the electricity suppliers in the Krayan region, Nunukan Regency, North Kalimantan, which is on the border between Indonesia and Malaysia.




Although PLN this year has succeeded in delivering electricity in the Krayan region, solar panels are still often used as an alternative because there are still several villages that have not been touched by electricity.




One of the PLTS which is supplying electricity to a number of areas in Krayan is in the area around Yuvia Semaring Airport and the Gabma Satgas Post of the TNI and RRD Sattas.




PLTS at Yuvia Semaring Airport is often used to meet electricity needs in the airport area.




Whereas PLTS at the Gabma Satgas Pamtas Post is used to become backup electricity.




Before PLN succeeded in penetrating the Indonesia-Malaysia border region, the region used solar panels to obtain electricity that was used to help people's daily activities.




However, because solar panels require sunlight as an energy supplier, electricity supply is also limited because at night the residents cannot charge. Therefore, the use of solar panels to meet electricity needs is saved in such a way as to be sufficient to be used until the evening.




But now residents in the Indonesia-Malaysia border no longer need to worry about running out of electricity at night. Because, PLN has succeeded in delivering electricity to a number of areas in Krayan, Nunukan Regency, North Kalimantan. PLTS is also used as an alternative electricity supplier or as a backup electricity power in the border region.
